Package pr1.helper.core

Class FileReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • pr1.helper.core.FileReader
  • public class FileReader
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple file reader utility class for reading text files with Scanner.

    This class provides convenience constructors that automatically build file paths based on FileTarget and optional subdirectories. It handles file access errors gracefully by printing warnings to System.err.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      FileReader​(FileTarget targetPath, java.lang.String file)
      Creates a new FileReader instance for the specified file located under the given target path.
      FileReader​(FileTarget targetPath, java.lang.String path, java.lang.String file)
      Creates a new FileReader instance for a file located in a subdirectory.

    • Method Summary

      void close()
      Closes the current Scanner instance if it exists.
      void createScanner()
      Creates a Scanner instance for the target file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileReader

        public FileReader​(FileTarget targetPath,
                  java.lang.String file)
        Creates a new FileReader instance for the specified file located under the given target path.
        Parameters:
        targetPath - the base directory defined by FileTarget
        file - the name of the file to be read

      • FileReader

        public FileReader​(FileTarget targetPath,
                  java.lang.String path,
                  java.lang.String file)
        Creates a new FileReader instance for a file located in a subdirectory.
        Parameters:
        targetPath - the base directory defined by FileTarget
        path - the relative subdirectory within the base directory
        file - the name of the file to be read

    • Method Detail

      • createScanner

        public void createScanner()
        Creates a Scanner instance for the target file.

        If the file cannot be found, an error message is printed to System.err.

      • getScanner

        public java.util.Scanner getScanner()
        Returns the current Scanner instance associated with this FileReader.
        Returns:
        the active Scanner, or null if not initialized

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the current Scanner instance if it exists.

        This method should be called to release system resources after reading is complete.
